title: Left Cholesteatoma with Otorrhea and Otalgia
chief_complaint: I have had pain in my left ear for years, but it has gotten much worse recently. My hearing in that ear has also dropped over the last 3 months, and I have drainage and itching.

problem_summary.onset: Chronic (several years) with acute exacerbation over the past 3 months.
problem_summary.course: Progressive worsening of pain and hearing loss.
problem_summary.laterality: Left ear symptoms; Right ear used for telephone.
problem_summary.functional_impact: Relies on right ear for communication; unable to use left ear for telephone.
problem_summary.goals_motivation: Seeking relief from pain and drainage; concerned about surgery.

history.present_illness: Patient reports left ear otalgia for several years, recently increasing in intensity. Noticed decreased hearing in the left ear over the past 3 months. Reports otorrhea and itching.
history.otologic_history: Diagnosed with left ear infection 2 weeks prior; symptoms did not subside with medication. Known perforation in the left tympanic membrane.
history.prior_management: Recent medical treatment for ear infection (failed).
history.patient_goals: Diagnosis and management of ear symptoms.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Right ear shows slight sensorineural hearing loss rising to normal (250-1000 Hz), sloping to moderate/moderately-severe in high frequencies. Left ear shows moderately severe rising to mild conductive loss (250-3000 Hz) sloping to severe conductive loss in highs. Significant air-bone gaps present in the left ear.

numeric_results.RE_AC_Thresholds: 250-1k Hz: ~15-20 dB HL; 4k Hz: ~35 dB HL; 8k Hz: ~60 dB HL
numeric_results.LE_AC_Thresholds: 250 Hz: 60 dB HL; 2k Hz: 35 dB HL; 8k Hz: 80 dB HL
numeric_results.LE_BC_Thresholds: 250-1k Hz: 10-15 dB HL; 4k Hz: 30 dB HL

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.key_findings: Speech Awareness Threshold (SAT) used due to language barrier. SAT results agreed with PTA. Word Recognition Score (WRS) could not be measured.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.key_findings: Right ear tympanogram was hypercompliant (Type Ad). Left ear not tested due to otorrhea.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.key_findings: Not measured due to artifact from hypercompliant TM (Right) and otorrhea (Left).

overall_audiologic_summary: The patient presents with a slight to moderately-severe high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss in the right ear and a significant conductive hearing loss in the left ear. The left ear demonstrates a large air-bone gap consistent with middle ear pathology. Speech testing was limited to detection thresholds (SAT) due to a language barrier, but results were consistent with pure-tone thresholds. Immittance testing revealed a hypercompliant system on the right and was deferred on the left due to active drainage.
counseling_points: A CT scan has confirmed a cholesteatoma (a skin cyst) in your left ear, which explains the drainage, pain, and hearing loss.
The standard medical recommendation is surgery (tympanoplasty and mastoidectomy) to remove the growth and make the ear safe.
Since you have decided against surgery for now, it is critical to attend regular follow-up appointments to 'wait and watch' the condition.
You must keep the left ear dry and report any changes in symptoms immediately.
notes_for_actor: You require an interpreter; do not speak English fluently.
You are hesitant/anxious about the idea of surgery and prefer a conservative approach despite the diagnosis.
You rely heavily on your right ear for communication, especially on the phone.
